paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Median age at testing: 71 years; 45% female; predominantly Black (81.9%)

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The median (IQR) age at testing in all patients with the p.V142I variant was 71 (59–78) years.

functional_data.summary: The p.V142I variant is the most common pathogenic variant associated with hATTR amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The p.V142I variant had the lowest known family history rate despite being the most common variant in this study.
variants.additional_notes: The p.V142I variant was identified most often with the cardiogenetics panel.
key_quotes: Only 31.7% of patients with a pathogenic TTR variant reported a known family history.
Patients with the p.V142I variant were predominantly Black (81.9%).

patients.demographics: Median age at testing: 57 years; 52% female; predominantly White (85.3%)

functional_data.summary: The p.T80A variant is one of the pathogenic variants associated with hATTR amyloidosis.

variants.additional_notes: The p.T80A variant was identified most often with the TTR single gene test.

patients.demographics: Median age at testing: 57 years; 47% female; predominantly White (72.6%)

functional_data.summary: The p.V50M variant is one of the pathogenic variants associated with hATTR amyloidosis.

variants.additional_notes: The p.V50M variant was identified most often with the TTR single gene test.

tables_processed.table_caption: Complete list of TTR variants identified in this study.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for TTR variants were extracted successfully.
